loans.name: Ologolimot

texts.en:
Ologolimot is a 33-year-old married man with four children. He does mixed farming where he rears livestock and does wheat farming. He has been doing this for the past five years.

He learned about KADET from the KADET staff. He is currently applying for his third loan after he repaid his previous loans well. He plans to spend part of the proceeds on his wheat farm and the remainder to purchase more sheep and goats for fattening.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children. He dreams to expand his farm.

loans.use: to plant on his farm and buy more livestock.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and the father of two children.

Mohamad has owned a shop since 2004, selling mobile phones and accessories. He has experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where a lot of potential customers pass by.

He decided to apply for a $2,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more stock. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more stock.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a 34 year old businessman who is married. His wife is a housewife and they are blessed with two children. He has been a hawker for the past year with a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Elijah will use the loan to buy belts, watches and albums for selling. With the anticipated profit he hopes to save for the education of his children. 

He hopes to open a retail shop and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy belts, watches, and albums for selling.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a hardworking businesswoman, age 46. She is married and blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. For the last year, she has been rearing goats to support her family. In the next five years, she wants to practice dairy farming. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more goats.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and the father of four children.

Hussein has owned a shop since 2005, selling frozen meat. He has experience in this field and he has a deep understanding of local customers and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot customers passing by him.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to repair and fix his shop’s walls and floors. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to repair and fix his shop’s walls and floors.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling used clothes for the last year to make a living. She has employed one person to help her to run the business. Gladys is able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 35 years old, married to Antony. They have two children who go to school. She runs a retail shop where she has been selling assorted household goods for the last four years for a monthly profit of KES. 30,000.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy mattresses, source pans, and slippers for sale.

With the anticipated profits, she will pay school fees for her children and save.

loans.use: to buy mattresses, source pans, and slippers for sale

loans.name: Abduorif

texts.ru: Абдуориф на протяжении 10 лет занимается скотоводством. Женат имеет одну дочь. Откорм крупного рогатого скота приносит доходу семье Абдуорифа. Но для откорма скота нужно много корма и травы. Цены с каждым днем меняются, дорожают. Поэтому Абдуориф хочет получить кредит на закупки 2 тонны корма для скота. Он надеется получить кредит и запастись кормом на зиму.
texts.en: Abduorif is married and has one daughter. He has made a living for the past ten years by breeding, fattening and selling large cattle. It's profitable, but prices are constantly changing and rising, hence Abduorif is asking for a loan in order to buy two tonnes of animal fodder. He's hoping to receive the loan and stock up enough feed to last the winter.

loans.use: To purchase animal fodder

loans.name: Colle

texts.fr: Collé est une petite commerçante, elle habite dans une ville proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Elle s'active dans le domaine du commerce depuis 2 ans. Le but de ce prêt est d'acheté des marchandises comme (des lessives en poudre, des parfums, du savon) qu'elle va revendre en détail au marché locale. Ce crédit lui permet d'être en mesure de répondre à la demande des clients qui est supérieur à l'offre. Avec ce crédit elle veut augmenté sa marge bénéficiaire afin d'avoir une autonomie financière pour satisfaire ses besoins personnel.
texts.en: Collé is a small-scale retailer who lives in a town near the capital of Senegal. She has been selling goods for two years. Her intention for this loan amount is to buy merchandise (such as powdered detergents, perfumes, soap) that she will sell retail at the local market. The loan will allow her to respond to the demand of her customers which is presently greater than what she can muster. With this loan she wants to grow her profit margin so that she can have financial autonomy so as to cover her own needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Dox Diam 2 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupement située dans une ville limitrophe de la capitale du Sénégal est composé de cinq femmes qui évoluent tous dans le domaine du commerce. Anta est la présidente de ce groupement, elle s'active dans le commerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Ce crédit est destiné a l'achat de marchandises divers comme (des chaussures, des tissus) et des produits alimentaires comme (du farine, de l'huile de palme, du sucre, du lait) qui sont revendu au niveau du marché local. Avec ce crédit, elle envisage gagné beaucoup de profits afin d'être autonome financièrement et d'aider son mari dans les taches ménagères et dans les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group is located in a city bordering the capital of Senegal, and consists of five women who work in trade. Anta, the president of the group, has been in business for over 15 years. She will use her loan to buy various items (such as shoes and fabrics) as well as food products (flour, palm oil, sugar, and milk) to sell at the local market. She expects that this credit will help her to earn substantial profits in order to become financially independent and help her husband with household responsibilities and the children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy shoes, fabrics, and food products for resale

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом занимается выращиванием ячменя и скотоводством. За кредитом он обращается впервые. Женат, имеет одного сына. В семье  работает один, жена домохозяйка. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести скот и заняться его откармливанием. На полученные средства от дохода он сыграет хатнатуй (обрезания) своего сына.
texts.en: Ilhom is involved in growing barley and in animal husbandry.  This is his first time requesting a loan.  He is married and has one son.  Ilhom is the only one working in the family, and his wife is a homemaker.  He wants to use this loan to buy livestock and start fattening it up.  He will use the resulting profits to hold a "hatnatuy" (circumcision) ceremony for his son.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has operated a house cleaning service for three years. She is a married woman. She has two children, both currently enrolled in school. Her other source of income is her husband's earnings. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge as low wages and her largest monthly expenses are rent and school fees. 

Joyce will use this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase roofing supplies for her home. Joyce wants to start her own business in the future. She joined Yehu because of their efficiency and flexibility.

loans.use: to purchase roofing supplies for her home.

loans.name: Diyaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, single and lives with six family members.

Diyaa has owned a furniture gallery since 2007, selling bedrooms, living rooms and dining tables and chairs. He has experience in this field and he has a deep understanding of local customers and a good reputation. His gallery is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot potential customers passing by him.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan in order to buy a tricycle truck for his business so he can deliver furniture. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle truck for his business so he can deliver furniture.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en: Mr. Jargal is 48 years old, married, and a father of three children. He lives in Dornod, a province of Mongolia, with his wife and two children. He works as a welder at local thermal power station. He has been doing this job for five years, and he managed to buy his own land and a house. His wife is on the dole.  He is a very diligent father and husband. He works hard to support his wife and two daughters. His elder son lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He just got married and started to build his own house. However, because of a lack of money he couldn’t finish the house before winter. Jargal is requesting a loan to help his son to purchase the building materials to finish building the house.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru:
Habiba zamujem no ne imeyet detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i svekrovyu. Habiba 30 let.
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kurici. Ona uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuricci.
texts.en: Habiba is married, but does not have children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her husband and mother-in-law.  Habiba is 30 years old.  She currently needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens.  She has been involved in poultry farming for three years.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Kodir

texts.ru: Кодир занимается выращиванием пшеницы и сельхоз культур. Выращивание пшеницы имеет свои доходы. Отходы от пшеницы идут на откорм скота. Но этот труд требует больших усилий. Кодир хочет приобрести займ для приобретения посевных семян и минеральных удобрений. Ведь для содержания жены и троих детей надо много работать, так как он является единственным кормильцем в семье.
texts.en: Kodir is involved in growing wheat and agricultural crops.  Growing wheat has its own income.  He uses the waste from the wheat to feed the livestock.  This labor requires a lot of effort.  Kodir wants to obtain a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  He needs to work a lot in order to support his wife and three children because he is the sole provider for his family.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Nyamzav

texts.en: Mr. Nyamzav is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and a son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian ger, a nomadic tent. He works as a driver at a bus company. His wife is an assistant worker in a cashmere factory. They both have a fixed income. He is a very hard working and honest person. Currently he and his family have been living in a house which is cold to live in during the winter time. Therefore, he started to build a new family house that is warm and comfortable. Now he needs some money to finish building the house. He is requesting a loan to purchase two vacuum windows, a door, and some bricks for completing the house.

loans.use: To purchase two vacuum windows, a door, and some bricks for completing the house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poplins, threads, and fabrics

loans.name: Farmonkul

texts.ru: Фармонкул вот уже более 10 лет занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он держит скот за счет кормов произведенных самим из своего земли. Он начинал свой бизнес с собственными капиталами и успешно продолжает данный бизнес. Фармонкул хочет расширить свой бизнес и обратился к «Имон Интернэшнл» за помощь. Он запрашивает займ в размере 2200$ США для покупки 7 голов быка. Полученный доход от данного бизнеса он хочет использовать для улучшения своего уровня жизни.
texts.en: Farmonkul has been involved in animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops for over 10 years.  He keeps livestock by using the fodder that he produces from his land.  He started his business with his own capital and continues to run it successfully.  Farmonkul wants to expand his business and went to "Imon International" for help.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $2200 for the purchase of 7 heads of bulls.  He wants to use the resulting profit to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her son’s business of painting sign boards. With the loan, he will buy paint and brushes to make better quality sign boards for his customers and increase his profits. 

Zarina is the mother of two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a driver and provides transport services to his customers. Her two daughters are teachers by profession while her third daughter stays at home and her youngest son reads in 10th standard. 

Zarina supports her family by doing clothes sewing work. She is very skilled and receives regular orders every month. 

Her son has been operating his business for the past four years and Zarina is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and increase his profits.  

Zarina wants to marry her elder daughter who is 26 years old. She is hopeful that she will be able to save some money from the loan profits for this purpose. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zarina”.

loans.use: to buy paints and brushes for a sign boards painting business

loans.name: Rabiyuvlo

texts.ru: Рабиювло возраст 42 года, женат, имеет 4 детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и ответственный человек, он 4 года занимается куплей и продажей сухофруктов и имеет хорошую прибыль. Он также занимается куплей и продажей свежих фруктов. В бизнесе ему помогает жена. Он полученного дохода он построил дом. Рабиювло  запрашивает займ  на сумму 11000 сомони для покупки товара, полученный займ поможет развить бизнес и принесет прибыль в семейный бюджет.
texts.en: Rabiyuvlo is 42 years old, married and has four children.  He is a hard-working and responsible person, who has been involved in buying and selling dried fruits for four years and makes a good profit.  He is also involved in buying and selling fresh fruits.  Rabiyuvlo's wife helps him in this business.  He used his profits to build a house.  Rabiyuvlo is requesting a loan in the sum of 11000 somoni to buy products.  This loan will help him to develop his business and bring a profit to the family budget.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is applying for another loan to expand her current business. She will use this 30,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase fruits, vegetables and other food supplies. In the future, Mwanamkuu aspires to continue improving her business and eventually open a wholesale shop. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanamkuu has been able to economically improve her family's standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase food for her food stall.

loans.name: Sherkuzi

texts.ru: Шеркузи занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и откормом скота. В ведении бизнеса помогает жена. У них на воспитании растут пятеро детей. Они занимаются выращиванием картофеля, ячменя, моркови. Откорм мелкого рогатого скота приносит хорошие доходы в сельской местности. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит на приобретение десяти голов мелкого рогатого скота и корма для них. Он очень надеется получить кредит.
texts.en: Sherkuzi grows agriculture crops and feeds cattle. His wife helps him run the business. They are raising five children. Sherkuzi and his wife grow potatoes, barley, carrots. The business of feeding small horned cattle gives them good profit in their rural area. This is why he wants to take out a loan to buy ten heads of small horned cattle for feeding. He is very hopeful to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a sheep.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a farmer in Muranga, Central Kenya. She is aged 71 and married with eight adult children. She has been in farming for 40 years, producing milk, honey, coffee and fish.

Cecilia has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chaff cutter in order to ease her dairy animals' feeding. She believes this will make the feeding of her dairy animals better, make them more productive and significantly reduce her feeding costs. She adds that the income will improve her living standards together with her family.

She is full of praise for Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Zavkibek

texts.ru: Завкибек женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Он занимается купля продажей скота и их откормом. Он содержит своих скот в хороших условиях и кормит их во время. Кроме этого он имеет землю, который занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает овощи, а также корм для своего скота. Завкибек хочет расширить свой бизнес  и улучшить свое условия жизни. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки 30 голов ягнят. Он заранее благодарить всех кредиторов за поддержку и поощрение.
texts.en: Zavkibek is married and a loving father of two children. He buys, sells and feeds cattle. He keeps his cattle in good conditions and feeds it on time. He also has a plot of land where he grows agriculture crops. He grows vegetables and also fodder for the cattle. Zavkibek wants to expand his business and improve his living conditions. He wants to get a loan to buy 30 heads of sheep. He is thanking all the lenders in advance for the support and encouragement.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Abdou habite dans une ville proche de Dakar la capitale du Sénégal. Il est commerçant et s'active dans ce domaine depuis plus de 25 ans. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des produits alimentaires comme (du poisson, des crevettes) qu'il se procure à la petite côte et qu'il va ensuite revendre dans sa ville. Il veut renforcer son pouvoir d'achat afin d'avoir beaucoup plus de profit pour satisfaire ses besoins personnels et familiers et de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants
texts.en:
Abdou lives in a town near Dakar, the capital of Senegal. He's been a merchant for more than 25 years. He's seeking this loan in order to buy food products, such as fish and shrimps, that he gets at Petite-Côte and resells in his town.

He wants to bolster his buying power to get much higher profits, in order to provide for himself and his family, as well as to pay his children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimps

loans.name: Rispah

texts.en:
Risper is a married woman with two grown children – one attends university, the other is in college. Her husband is self-employed as a private medical practitioner. Risper operates a poultry business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for almost a year, as well as operating a medical clinic. Her greatest business challenge is getting supplies during the low tourist season. Her largest monthly expenses are rent and employee salaries at the clinic. Risper rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Risper will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase baby chicks from the countryside. Risper aspires to expand the business and become a wholesale supplier. She joined Yehu because of their affordable interest rates, flexibility and sufficient repayment times.

loans.use: To purchase baby chicks from the countryside.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has four children, and all are currently enrolled in school. Her husband works in construction. Elizabeth operates a food stall and a clothing resale business, and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are local residents and neighbors. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Elizabeth's other source of income includes running a resident house. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality, and her largest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Elizabeth will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to pay for her children's school fees. Elizabeth aspires to run her own wholesale business in the future. She joined Yehu because of their welcoming rates.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
40-year-old Hong lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. The couple have two children, one son and one daughter. Her husband earns an income by cutting glass and copper. 

Hong has tried to support her family by selling food and fruit juice for six years. This work provides her and her family with a daily income to meet the family's' basic living expenses.

Hong would like to take out a loan to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity of food to sell to her customers, and by buying new furniture for her stall. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income, improve the living conditions of her family, and save for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of food to sell to her customers, and buy new furniture for her stall.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi, 38, is a married woman with two children. She and her husband make incense to earn a living. They started this business 12 years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Vi is requesting a loan to buy materials that will enable her to work together with her husband to increase their production. She hopes that this will assist her to make a higher income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials to increase her production of incense.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 39, is married and has two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife has been running a general store in front of their house. 

He has supported his family by running a mechanical shop at his house for eight years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying equipment and materials to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his children to school.

loans.use: To buy equipment and materials for his mechanical shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timber for roofing, doors, windows and shutters, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Xuong

texts.en:
Xuong is 64 years old and single. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City and runs a general store to earn a living. 

She started her business seven years ago. She sells incense and worship-related products. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different goods to stock her store and better meet her customers needs. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different goods to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy powdered juices, milk, cheese, and sugar

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 56 years old and is divorced. She has been running a cafe in front of her door for 15 years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise four children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hoa is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing more food and many kinds of soft drinks to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand this business, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food and many kinds of soft drinks for her cafe.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, a farmer in Murang'a, Central Kenya, has been in farming for over 20 years with one farmhand, producing and selling milk, vegetables and coffee to the local market. He is married with 5 children. 

Simon has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter for his dairy farm. He says it will help improve his dairy production and save him the costs incurred in wastage of animal fodder. He remains optimistic about the business growth.

He, however, laments the high costs of the management of diseases.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 46-year-old married man with a son. He lives with his wife and son in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hoa and his wife have been running a food stall for nearly six years. They sell Thai noodles to people in the local community. He intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet his customers' demands. 

He hopes that through the loan he can earn more money with his current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan, 28 years old, is married. She lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ngan earns a living by sewing clothes at her house. She has been occupied in this business for nearly ten years. She intends to use her loan to buy fabric and materials to increase her production.

Ngan hopes her business runs smoothly and that it will help to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and materials to increase her production of clothes.

loans.name: Bokk Xol Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 JUIN 2001. Il  est  constitué de dix femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Seynabou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autre enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits et légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 7, 2001. It consists of ten women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is trade.

Mrs. Seynabou is the head of the group. She is at the far right of the photo with a hand raised. She is 57 years old and married without children. She does however look after three children left in her care by relatives.

She sells fruits and vegetables. She has a good command of her activity, having been in the business for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her working capital and better expand her activities.

She will use the profits to improve her family’s living conditions (healthcare, food, clothing, etc.).

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, 54 years old, is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a driver. Phan has been running a shop for 25 years, making iron braces. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phan intends to take a loan to buy iron pieces and metalworking equipment. The additional materials and equipment will enable her to increase her production of iron braces. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional materials and equipment for her production of iron braces.

loans.name: Fatou Kiné

texts.fr: Fatou est une commerçante, elle vie dans une localité située à l'ouest du Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le domaine du commerce depuis plus de 7 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des provisions (café, lait, sucre, chocolat, beurre, fromage) pour son commerce. Avec ce prêt elle veut avoir beaucoup plus de profits qui lui permettra d'être autonome financièrement, de faire ses dépenses sans problème et de payer les frais scolaire de sa fille
texts.en:
Fatou lives in a town in Western Senegal. She's been a merchant for more than seven years. She's seeking a loan to buy groceries (coffee, milk, sugar, chocolate, butter, and cheese) for her business.

With this loan, she wants to get much higher profits, in order to be financially autonomous and able to pay her daughter's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy coffee, milk, sugar, chocolate, butter, and cheese

loans.name: Kassofor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 JUIN 2001. Il  est  constitué de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce. 

Madame Aby qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est veuve  sans enfants. Mais elle en charge trois enfants confié par ses parents et proches.

Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits et légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer son activité de vente de fruits et légumes.

Les profits générés par son petit commerce lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et d’améliorer les conditions de vie des enfants qui lui sont confiés par exemple: la nourriture la santé etc.…).
texts.en:
Kassofor Group was established on June 7, 2001. It is made up of twelve women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is retailing.

Mrs. Aby, raising her hand on the right in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 65 years old, a widow, and without children. But she has three children entrusted to her by family.

She sells fruits and vegetables. She's been running this business for several years, and has a good experience in this field. This loan will enable her to bolster her working capital and better expand her business.

The profits of her business enable her to provide for herself and improve the standard of living (food, healthcare) of the children she has to support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 27 years old. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her two children and husband. 

Her husband is a bricklayer. Ly earns an income by making shoes at her house. She intends to take a loan to purchase better quality materials to increase her production of shoes.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy better quality materials to increase her production of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food condiments.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a widow with 6 children, all of whom are currently enrolled in school. She was previously employed as a charcoal saleswoman and now operates a motorbike business. She has worked in this business for 9 months, and her primary customers are passersby and loyal customers. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and competition, and her largest monthly expense is school fees. 

Tabu will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy a second motorbike. Tabu aspires to own her own motorbike shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of their low interest rates compared to other organizations.

loans.use: To buy a second motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three dairy cows.

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Далер перспективный и умный юноша. Ему 21 год, не женат. Несмотря на свою молодость, он имеет за его плечами 4 летний предпринимательский опыт. Далер занимается куплей и продажей мебели. Он продает спальные гарнитуры, шкафы, столы и стулья, диваны  и многое другое. Ему привозят товары из  центра на общую сумму $1500 США. Далер открыл свою точку и хочет расширить  бизнес, но не имеет нужной суммы. Он запрашивает займ на сумму $2000 США для  покупки мебели и увеличения товарооборота. Этот займ поможет Далеру в развитии бизнеса.
texts.en: D. is a promising and smart young man. He is 21 years old, he is not married. Although he is young he has four years of experience doing business. D. buys and sells furniture. He sells bedroom sets, dressers, tables and chairs, sofas and many other things. The merchandise is delivered to him from the city center for the total amount of $1,500 USD. D. opened his space and wants to expand the business, but does not have the necessary amount. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $2,000 USD to buy furniture and increase commodity circulation. This loan will help D. in growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy furniture and increase commodity turnover.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is aged 24 and married with 4 children between the ages of 11 and 1. She has been farming for 10 years and currently employs one farmhand. Her farm produces milk and maize for the local market.

Joan has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi, a Kiva partner, to help her buy and insure a dairy cow. She sees herself being a large scale dairy farmer. She hopes she will generate enough income to provide her family with basic needs.

She says the high cost of feeds is a great limitation in the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman with 6 children. Her husband works as a driver. She operates a grain business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for 16 years, and her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her largest monthly expense is food. 

Kanze will use the Kes 60,000 loan to build a shade for her stand. She aspires to own a wholesale business in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: To build a shade for her stand.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a single woman and has 1 child. She operates a fish shop and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 10 years and her primary customers are fishmongers. She lives in her family’s house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her largest monthly expense is food. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a freezer to keep her goods fresh. Kadzo aspires to export fish to other markets in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: To buy a freezer to keep her goods fresh.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 33, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. Her husband earns an income with his business of recycling waste materials. Nga lives with her children and  husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nga has been in business for ten years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics and other materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 50-year-old woman with three children, two sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling food and soft drinks. 

For the past six years, she has run a food stall T. cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan T. buy many kinds of beverages T. provide T. her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her T. improve her living conditions, and allow her T. set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a married woman. Her husband works as a driver. Sara operates a charcoal business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for two years and her primary customers are charcoal retailers. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenges as seasonality and transportation and her largest monthly expense is food. 

Sara will use the Kes 40,000 loan to build a shelter for her business and add more charcoal sacks. Sara aspires to have several charcoal stands in the future. She joined Yehu to gain access to working capital.

loans.use: To build a shelter for her business and add more charcoal sacks.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 54-year-old married mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Nga's husband is retired and covering all family expenses depends on her business of electronic game machines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Nga would like to take a loan to expand her business by buying more game machines. She hopes this will enabL. her to attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more game machines to serve her customers.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa lives with her husband and four children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. T. support her family, Hoa earns an income by selling rice. She started this business five years ago. 

Hoa would like T. take a loan T. expand her current business. With the loan, she will buy more kinds of rice of better quality which will enable her T. attract additional customers. 

Hoa hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her T. improve her family's living conditions and enable her T. set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a labourer. For six years Phung has operated a store/cafe in front of her house.

Phung would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and other products such as packaged foods to stock her store/cafe. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Phung also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy beverages and other products such as packaged food to stock her store.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 41 years old, married to Caroline, and they have one school-going child. Antony operates an electronics shop as a primary business and also transports goods for the last ten years and with a monthly profit of KES. 7,000. He is a hard-working man.  


He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to repair his vehicle.

The anticipated profits he will save, and he offer the basic needs for his family. In  future he plans to grow his business and own a pick-up.

loans.use: to  repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a married woman. She has five children with four currently enrolled in school. Mwanamvua operates a community health business and sells her goods door-to-door. She's worked in this business for 10 years and her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her largest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mwanamvua will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy containers of drugs. Mwanamvua aspires to own a community health center in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital while paying lower interest compared with other organizations.

loans.use: To buy containers of drugs.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is a 42-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Oanh and her husband earns money through a business of  repairing and selling air conditioners. They have been involved in this business for ten years. Now, Oanh would like to take out a loan to invest in the business to help it expand. She plans to use this loan to buy and then repair second-hand air conditioners and then sell these to her customers. 

She hopes that through this loan she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. This will enable her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy old air-conditioners to repair and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a farmer, a tailor and a mother of two aged 5 and 3 in Kitale area of Western Kenya. She has been in farming for seven years and her farm currently produces milk and vegetables which go to the local market.

Annah has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says her loan will improve her family's living standards by improving her farming income. She hopes to improve her farming and become a larger supplier of milk and vegetables in the area.

She laments poor feeds and rampant animal diseases in the area.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Mujeres Unidas esta compuesto por 14 integrantes D. la ciudad D. Encarnación , son clientes a partir del mes D. setiembre con excelente conducta D. pago en todos los créditos que han solicitado. El comité está tratando D. adquirir experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que llevan poco tiempo trabajando juntas, se reúnen cada semana para compartir, comunicar e interiorizarse D. las novedades que se generan dentro del grupo. 
Una D. las integrantes, Adelaida, está casada con Rafael, cuya profesión es mecánico, tienen 2 hijos. Adelaida es una señora que se dedica a la venta D. carteras y la venta D. ropa. Su deseo es poder tener un local donD. pueda exponer sus PRODUCTOS, para así poder ayudarle a su marido a mejorar los ingresos D. su hogar. Es por eso que se integro al comité D. su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundacion Paraguaya pueda seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. ropas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named "Mujeres Unidas" is formed by 14 members in the city of Encarnacion. They are clients who up to the month of September have had excellent payment history on all of the loans requested. The group is trying to acquire experience in working as a group as they have been working together only a short while. They meet every week to share, communicate, and to bring themselves up to date on the news within the group.

One of the members is Adelaida. She is married to Rafael, whose profession is to be a mechanic. They have 2 children. Adelaida is a woman who dedicates her time to the sale of purses and clothing. Her wish is to have a store from where to sell her products in order to help her husband to improve the household income. She joined the group within her community so that with the help of Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) she will be able to keep growing.

She requests a loan to purchase clothing, to supply her business and to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has seven children with all currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a mechanic. Rose operates a business selling charcoal, maize and firewood and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for three years and her primary customers are cafes and neighbors. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. She describes her greatest business challenges to be transportation and seasonality and her largest monthly expense is school fees. 

Rose will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy charcoal bags and build a shelter to cover the firewood. Rose aspires to earn enough capital to open a poultry business in the future. She joined Yehu because of their low interest rates and membership fees compared to other organizations.

loans.use: To buy charcoal bags and build a shelter to cover the firewood.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en: Jefferson is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. He describes himself as a humble person. He has been baking cakes for the last four years to make a living. He has employed four people to help him to manage the business. His customers are people of his area of residence. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as cooking fat, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as cooking fat, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Moses has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and household supplies. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy essential commodities like rice since it's now in such high demand, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and pay school fees for their child who has just entered school. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another business in the village. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy essential commodities like rice.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is 35 years old and lives in the town of Ishaka in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Dan has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells food and household supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Dan has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food supplies for the business and will help Dan to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Dan hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a wholesale business in town. 

Dan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 25 years old and is married. Her business is well-organized and is well-known for selling various goods such as: milk, biscuits, water, bread, sugar, juice, etc. Her business hours are from 8am until 7pm every day except on Saturday, and she currently employs one person to help her.

Rehema has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more new goods such as: lotions, biscuits, soap, cooking oil etc. for sale. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future and also pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more lotions, biscuits, soap, cooking oil and so on.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married and blessed with two children. She practices pig and horticulture farming to make a living. She also operates a taxi transport business to earn extra income. Jane has employed two people to help her to manage the business. In the next five years, she wants to own a greenhouse. With 40,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy more pigs and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is applying for another loan to start a new dairy farming business. She will use this Kes 80,000 loan to invest in a dairy farm. In the future, Eutropia aspires to become a supplier for big hotels and have a large poultry and dairy farm in the future. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Eutropia has been able to improve her family's living standard. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to start a new dairy farming business.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past seven years, Gerald has been working hard to manage his electronics store, which mainly sells and repairs computers. 

To help expand his business, Gerald has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more computers and replacement parts and will help Gerald to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Gerald hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Gerald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gerald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more computers and replacement parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, salt and juice.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is aged 36 and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is married with four children aged between 20 and 4 and all schooling. She has been in farming for over six years with her produce of milk, eggs and vegetables going to the local market.

Pamela has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to give a boost to her poultry farming by purchasing more poultry birds.She says this will increase her family's income and make life more bearable.She is focusing on rearing at least 1000 birds in her farm.

She concurs with other farmers about high cost of feed which is a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. For the past five years, Betty has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, where she styles hair and sells cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Betty is requesting a loan for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cosmetic supplies for resale and will help Betty to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to start a hair dressing academy. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is applying for a loan to use to expand her snack-selling business. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy cooking oil and flour. In the future, she hopes to continue expanding her business, and she has made good use of previous loans to improve her living standards. She hopes to continue to use the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. For the past three years, Irene has been working hard to manage her bricklaying business, which sells bricks for local construction projects. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more supplies to make bricks, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a daycare center. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to make bricks

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. He runs a butchery to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years. He has employed four people to help him to run the business. He also roasts and sells meat in the same business premises. 

Joseph has retained his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In five years, he wants to become more financially stable. He has requested for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy an energy-saving cooker for roasting meat.

loans.use: To buy an energy-saving cooker.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing soft drinks and fruit juices to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. For the past three years, Edward has been working hard to manage his small bar, which serves drinks and snacks to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Edward has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cases of beer, and will help Edward to generate greater profits and improve his family's quality of life. Edward hopes that in the future he will be able to build a bigger bar with a guest house. 

Edward is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edward who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of beer to sell.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a hardworking business man, age 24. He is married and blessed with one child. He runs an electronic shop to make a living. He also operates a motorbike transport business to earn extra money. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy bulbs, and radio and television spare parts for resale.

loans.use: To buy bulbs, and radio and television spare parts.

loans.name: Bay

texts.en:
Bay is a 54-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Bay and her husband have been earning a living by running a food stall from the door of their house for the past two years. They sell noodles and braised beef. 

She would like to borrow money to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of food to sell from her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity of food to sell from her noodle stall.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is married and blessed with two children, both of whom are in school. For the last four years, she has earned a living by running a shop where she sells cereals. She now has one employee who helps her run her business and hopes, in the next five years, to become a distributor of cereals to her region of Kenya. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize and beans to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 32 years old, married and has four school-aged children. For the last eight years, she has earned a living by selling tomatoes and earns a profit of KES 4,600 a month. Mercy was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a client of our organization and is now applying for her third loan, which she will use to buy crates of tomatoes to sell to her customers. She will use the additional profits made possible by this loan to meet her family's basic needs. In the future, she plans to continue expanding her business and earn enough money to educate her children through the college level.

loans.use: to buy crates of  tomatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu is 42 years old, married and has two sons. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh city, and earns a living by running a stall where she sells toys and candy. She has been in this line of work for 15 years and is applying for this loan to buy more toys to sell to her customers. She plans to use the loan to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy toys to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 30 years old and is married. He has two children. In his village, Jean Bosco owns a shop where he sells clothes. This is his third successful year in this business and the hours of this business are from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Jean Bosco has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his working capital and buy more clothes to sell. Jean Baptiste will earn more profits. With these profits, he will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 49 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has five children. For the past six years, he has worked hard at managing his retail shop, where he sells food and supplies people use in their homes. 

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more food to sell. His goals are to increase his profits and improve his family's quality of life. Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but run businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past three years, Annet has been working hard to manage her furniture shop, which makes and sells furniture to local families. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more wood to make furniture, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to continue to grow her business. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional supplies for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Jeanine

texts.en:
Jeanine is 30 years old and married with two children between 3 and 4 years old. Jeanine owns a business selling clothes and tableware. This is her fourth successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 5 pm every day.

Jeanine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her clothes and tableware (glasses, dishes, cups, plates, etc). With the profits, she will be able to build her own house and she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more tableware and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elima

texts.en: Elima is married and blessed with one child who is still in school. She operates a retail shop to bring up the family. She has been in the business for the last two years. In the next 5 years, she wants to manage  a supermarket. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. With 50,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy cooking fat, sugar and detergent for resale.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar and detergent.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 50, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines, a single parent with four children. She, together with her children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Alicia operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  Aside from this she also cooks breakfast meals for additional income.Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1200 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Alicia hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business

loans.name: Mastulah

texts.en:
Mastulah is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda. Her husband passed away a while ago, but was survived by Mastulah and his four children. For the past two years, Mastulah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells food and home supplies. 

To help expand her business, Mastulah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food and supplies for resale, and will help Mastulah to generate greater profits and improve her quality of life. Mastulah hopes that in the future she will be able to continue to grow her business. 

Mastulah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mastulah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food and supplies for resale

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard is 38 years old and is married with five children between one and ten years old. He is well-known in the business of selling rice, sugar, and cooking oil. He has been in this business for about ten years, and his business hours are from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day.

Gerard has requested a loan from Vision Finance Company, a Kiva Partner, in order to purchase a greater quantity of goods like rice, sugar, cooking oil, and cassava flour.

If successful, Gerard hopes that he will earn more profits than he did previously. With these profits, he will keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like rice, sugar, cooking oil, and cassava flour.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past ten years, Stella has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells flower arrangements and other decorations. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase flowers, and will help Stella to generate greater profits and improve her quality of life. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to open a large flower supply business, and begin exporting. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase flowers

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman and has 2 children currently enrolled in school. Jackline owns a salon that she operates out of her home for the past 3 years. Before opening her salon, Jackline supported the family as a housewife. Her primary customers are neighbors and passerby. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her largest monthly expense is food. 

Jackline will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase beauty products for the salon. Jackline aspires to modernize her salon in the future. She joined Yehu because of their efficient loan products.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for the salon.

loans.name: Saidath

texts.en:
Saidath is 57 years old and is married. Saidath is commonly known for selling African clothes and underwear. This is her tenth successful year in this business. Her business hours are from 8 am until 8 pm every day.

Saidath needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing different styles of African clothes and underwear to sell. With these additional styles of African clothes and underwear, Saidath hopes to earn more profits. This will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and providing all the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: EL Señor Jaime, es una persona de 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar el bachillerato en humanidades, actualmente vive y su fábrica está en la casa de su padre y cuenta con un solo dependiente economico la cual es su pequeña hija. La actividad económica del cliente es la fabricación y venta de pelotas de futsal y futbol como anteriormente se mencionó en la casa de su padre y la comercialización de sus productos los realiza principalmente a los comerciantes minoristas de la ciudad de Cochabamba y algunas provincias de la misma. El señor Jaime manifiesta ser una persona responsable que tiene ganas de superarse y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de reposición por la compra de un lote, donde construirá su propia vivienda y de esta forma poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jaime is a 28 year old man and he is single. He achieved his high school diploma in the humanities. Her currently lives with his father and has a business in the house. His only economic dependent is his little daughter. His business is making soccer and futsal balls, and, as mentioned before, he does this in his father's house. He sells his products mostly to the small businesses in the city of Cochabamba and some of the provinces of the city. Jaime is a responsible person who wants to excel and for this reason he needs capital to buy a plot of land where he can build his own home and so improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a lot of land to build his home.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has two children. For the past five years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which serves hot, traditional Ugandan meals to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food and supplies, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve the standards of living for her family. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a bigger restaurant and start an outside catering business. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food and supplies

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 42 years old and she is married. Jeanne makes a living by selling a variety of drinks like milk, beer and so on in her shop, and this is her 14th successful year in this business. Jeanne's business is open from 10 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

After realizing that her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Jeanne will purchase more drinks and earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks like juice, milk and beer.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and has one child who is enrolled in school. Her husband works as a fishmonger. Rose operates a general store and has worked in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and passerby. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be theft and her largest monthly expense is food. 

Rose will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase sugar, detergent, flour, salt and other supplies. Rose aspires to be the leading supplier in her village in the future. She joined Yehu because of their efficient loan products.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, detergent, flour, salt and other supplies.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a father of 2 aged 7 and 1. He is a resident and a farmer in Litein South Rift Kenya. He has been in farming for 3 years producing and selling tea, maize and  milk to the local market. His family fully relies on family for their upkeep.

Moses has requested for a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional income will help him expand his dairy business and provide for his family basic needs. He is focusing on building a modern dairy unit for his animals.

His challenge however remains insufficient dairy feeds.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has 2 children with 1 currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a driver. Florence sells potatoes, samosas and other goods door-to-door. She's worked in this business for 2 years and previously had a job selling chickens. Her primary customers are neighbors and passerby. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water and her largest monthly expense is food. Florence’s greatest business challenge is that her clients have very low purchasing power. 

Florence will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase cooking oil, flour and sugar. Florence aspires to expand and open a food stall in the future. She joined Yehu because of their efficient loan products.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 44 and married. She also cares for three relatives and has a decoration business. Betty has been working in this business for about four years. Her business is open from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. most days of the week.

Betty has requested a loan from Kiva to purchase more decorations. With her profit, she will reinvest in this business, pay her children's school fees and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more decorations to sell.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 39 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has three children. For the past eight years, Milly has been working hard to manage her salon, which styles hair and does hair extensions for local clients. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hair care supplies, and will help Milly to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Milly hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a training school for hair dressing. 

Milly is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Milly who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more hair care supplies

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine, 32, is married and has two children age 2 and 5. She has been selling clothes for about three years and her hours of operation are from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. daily.

Vestine has requested this loan through Vision Finance Company in order to sell different styles of clothes. The extra income from this loan will help her business and enable her to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 26 years old. He is single and supports his parents. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

Leonard learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children in the future.

Leonard's hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. He is a diligent man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past nine years, Irene has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which serves hot meals to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food supplies, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another restaurant in town. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food supplies

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Harriet has a business of a shop selling films, cameras and phone batteries.  She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Harriet sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Harriet has requested for a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more phone batteries, camera films, airtime and sole tape.  The main business challenges for Harriet include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own fully stocked shop and to educate her children up to university. Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more phone batteries, airtime, cameras, films and sole tape

loans.name: Kidemi

texts.en:
Kidemi is 34-years old and married with three children who are in school. He does mixed farming i.e. rearing sheep and wheat farming which he has been doing for the past seven years.

Kidemi learned about Kadet through a KADET staff member and he is a good client. He has currently applied for his third loan which he plans to spend part on farming and the remainder to purchase more sheep for fattening.

Kidemi hopes to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his farm.

loans.use: To spend part on farming and the remainder on more sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old and is married with three children. He is well-known in the business of selling bed covers, pans and towels. He has been in this business for about two years, and his business hours are from 7am until 8pm every day.

Joseph has requested a loan from Vision Finance Company, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase more pans, towels, bed covers, etc. If successful, Joseph hopes that he will earn more profits than he has in the past.  With these profits, he will keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future and also save for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more bed covers, towels and pans.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew, a farmer, is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya. He is aged 36 and has been in farming for 7 years. His produce of milk and maize go to the local market where he runs a milk retail business. Andrew has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow and give a boost to his dairy output. He also wants to buy a cereal-grinding machine and transportation to make it easier to get his goods to the market. A poor road network makes delivery of supplies to the market costly. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their support of farmers

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anmoli

texts.en:
Anmoli is 35 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. For the past three years, Anmoli has been working hard to manage his small bar, which serves snacks and drinks to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Anmoli has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.
