Carolina is a widowed mother of four children, three of whom still live with her and whom she has to care for and help with her sustenance and education.  She says her biggest challenge has been getting over the death of her husband.  She enjoys working with beauty products, and hopes to be able to have a salon very soon and dedicate herself to this work activity.

In the name of her group she thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is married with five children. She is 44 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. Jocelyn has a general store that helps her earn a living, and she has had this business for three months. Each month, she earns 3,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase stock for her general store. Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Sofronio Jr.

texts.en: Sofronio is from the village of Sta. Filomena. He is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Sofronio Jr. owns and operates a coffee farm. He has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for his coffee farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his coffee farm

loans.name: Litas

texts.en: Litas  is from the village of Obay, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 46 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children.  Litas has a general store. She earned PHP 3000 each month doing this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase stocks for her general store.  Litas had been a member in Paglaum MPC for 3 years.

loans.use: buy stock for her store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 44 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has 4 children.  Helen works in the fishing industry and resells as well as catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years.  

Helen has requested loan for PHP 3000 to purchase more fish to sell.  Helen has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 51 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with seven children.

Luzminda works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase three boxes of fish to sell.

Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Luzminda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase three boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lorrilie

texts.en:
Lorrilie is 33 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez. She is married with two children. 

Lorrilie has a services business and earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 40,000 to purchase new barber shop materials for her barber shop. 

Lorrilie has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Lorrilie hopes to have number of barber shops in the province.

loans.use: To purchase new barber shop materials for her barber shop.

loans.name: Romer

texts.en:
Romer is 59 years old and lives in Lawa-an Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is married but has no children. 

Romer has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Romer has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Romer hopes to have a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 63 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two children. 

Vicente has a fisherfolk business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan  of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Vicente has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Vicente hopes to have many fishing boats in order help their financial and daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 53 years old and lives in Upper Rizal, Oroquieta City. She is married with five children. 

Margarita has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,0000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks. 

Margarita has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future,  Margarita hopes to have a food stall. She is a hard-working mother and MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 53 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with six children. 

Narcisa has a sari-sari (variety) store business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Narcisa has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Narcisa hopes to  have a grocery store. She is a MIGS member of PMPC. She has a  happy family, is a good mother, and she takes good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old and lives in Lubogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married  with six children. 

Rosa has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 12,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. 

Rosa has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Rosa hopes to have a fishing boat. She is hard-working and has a happy family. She is a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old and lives in Lubogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She  is married with seven children. 

Marites has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more fish to sell

Marites has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Marites hopes to have a big capital.so that they can earn money for their children. Marites is a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is a widow with four children. Leonidas is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Leonidas is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 35 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her corn. 

Leonidas has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Leonidas hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is 37 years old, married with two children. One of them is studying while other is less than 4 years old.  Her husband is a fruit seller. He sells different varieties of fresh seasonal fruit to his customers. The quality as well as the price of his fruit is very fair; that’s why he makes a good number of sales and earns reasonably good profits from his business. 

Safia herself is an active and efficient lady and performs her household duties very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband because the winter season is coming and he needs new season fruit to sell to earn better profits. 

He has been operating his business for the past four years and Safia is hopeful that an investment will help him make better profits from his business.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell.

loans.name: Shahla's Group

texts.en:
Shahla has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s spare parts business. He started his business 10 years ago with a small investment. Now he is well established in his business but he needs continuous investment to purchase spare parts for his shop. He is a very hard worker with a good business sense. Shahla is hopeful that her husband’s business will bring more profits to him after making an investment into it. 

She is a mother of five children. Two of her children are studying while her other three children are young and not of school-going age yet. Shahla is a very active and supportive lady who does her household responsibilities very well and tries her best to provide comfort to her family.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahla.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Vilayat

texts.en:
Vilayat is 45 years old, married and has three children. He has been working as a farmer for many years. Vilayat is involved in growing fruit trees: pomegranate, apple, pear, etc. He sells seedlings and fruits in the local bazaar. He is also involved in fattening up and selling livestock. 

This is his second loan from Kiva and AqroInvest. Vilayat used his earlier profits to buy three dairy cows. 

He requested a loan in the sum of 1,500 AZN for the purchase of more seeds and fertilizer to improve his soil.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizer to improve the soil.

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her son’s laundry business. With the loan, he will buy washing powder, bleach and an iron because he offers his customers an additional service of pressing their clothes.
 
Rasoolan is a very active lady who sells buffalo milk to her community clients. She has kept a buffalo for that purpose at her home. She takes its milk and sells on profit. 

Her son started his business three years ago and is still working hard to get established in his business. Rasoolan is hopeful that after the loan investment, he will be able to increase his profits and improves his clientele base. She always remains worried about the future of her children because she couldn’t provide quality education to her children due to poor financial conditions. That’s why she wants them to do well in their business and secure their future.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rasoolan.

loans.use: To buy washing powder, bleach and an iron for her laundry business

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is 33 years old. In order to financially support her husband, she sews clothes for her community clients. Due to the good quality of work, she receives regular orders every month. 

Her husband runs a grocery store in the market. Through his store, he sells daily used items such as sugar, spices, lentils, rice etc. He is very fair in his rates and earns good profits from his business. 

She has given birth to three children: one of them is studying while the others are very young and haven’t started their education yet. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk, which will allow him to fulfill the client's orders and earn better profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past nine years. Asia is very sure that his business will be improved further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 36 years old, divorced and lives with her brother. He is a fruit seller. He sells fresh seasonal fruits to his customers at reasonable rates. Shazia started embroidery work 12 years ago. Now, she has become expert in her field and receives regular orders every month. She is the mother of a son who is a factory worker. Due to poor financial circumstances, she couldn’t educate her son.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in bulk, which will allow her to offer better quality embroidery works to her clients and increase her income. She doesn’t want to become a burden on her brother and hopes that she will successfully be able to upgrade her business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed for calves

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is 44 years old.  Her husband sells wheat.  He purchases wheat from the wholesale market and sells to his local area clients for profit. Sughran is a seamstress.  She started this business a few years ago to financially support her husband. She is very good at her work and receives a good number of orders every month. 

Sughran is the mother of 4 children. Her eldest daughter weaves carpet while the others are studying in different classes.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s wheat selling business. With this loan, he will buy wheat in bulk quantity to allow him to supply larger quantities of wheat to his client and earn more profit.   He is an experienced person in his business and has been operating it for the past 5 years.  Sughran is confident that an investment will help him improve his business further.

loans.use: to buy wheat

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина живет с мужем в городе Бердянске. Ее взрослые дети давно живут отдельно. Галина занимается торговлей на центральном рынке своего, реализует хозтовары и посуду вот уже 8 лет. На этом рынке у Галины нет конкурентов, она одна продает такой товар. Товар очень качественный. На данный момент оборотный капитал составляет 50 000 гривен. 

Кредит КИВА в 12 000 гривен Галина планирует использовать для закупки дополнительного товара, а именно кастрюль, сковородок, столовых сервизов и т.п. для удачной реализации в дальнейшем. Обновив ассортимент реализуемой продукции, Галина сможет привлечь новых покупателей, увеличится покупательская способность и увеличится товарооборот. Галина предприимчива и всегда старается трудолюбиво относиться к своему бизнесу, вежливо обслуживает клиентов. Все эти факторы, несомненно, влияют на успешное развитие бизнеса Галины.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Galina lives with her husband in the city of Berdyansk. Her adult children live separately for a long time. Galina sells household goods and china on the central market of her city for eight years now. Galina does not have competitors on this market, she is the only one who sells such merchandise. Her merchandise is of very high quality. At this time her working capital is 50,000 hryvna.

Galina plans to use the 12,000 hryvna loan from Kiva to buy additional merchandise, such as pots, pans, dinner sets and etc, for successful resale in the future. By renewing the variety of her merchandise Galina will attract new customers, increase purchasing power and commodity turnover. Galina is entrepreneurial and always has a hardworking attitude towards her business, and is polite towards her customers. All these factors certainly have an impact in the successful growth of Galina's business.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise such as pots, pans, dinner sets and etc, for successful resale in the future.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.ru:
Олег работает на центральном рынке города Бердянска. Он занимается цветами и держит свой цветочный павильон в цветочном рядку на этом рынке. Олег женат, у него две взрослых дочери. У бизнеса Олега есть основное преимущество: он предлагает большой выбор цветов по минимальной цене по сравнению с конкурентами соседями по рынку. На данный момент оборотный капитал Олега составляет 25 000 гривен. 

Олегу необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить оптом живые цветы и комнатные растения на продажу, а также сопутствующие товары. Получение кредита благотворным образом отразится на бизнесе клиента, так как клиент, закупив цветы, сможет увеличить оборотные средства и таким образом сможет привлечь свободные денежные средства для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Oleg works on the central market of the city of Berdyansk. He is in the flower business and has own flower pavilion in the flower aisle on the market. Oleg is married and has two adult daughters. Oleg's business has a big advantage: he offers a large variety of flowers at a minimal price in comparison with the competing neighbors on the market. At this time Oleg's working capital is 25,000 hryvna.

Oleg needs a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvna to buy live flowers and house plants in wholesale for resale as well as related merchandise. This loan will make a positive impact on his business because by purchasing the flowers he will be able to increase the working capital and this way free up some cash for further growth of his business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh flowers and house plants in wholesale for resale, as well as related goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of four heads of cattle.

loans.name: Nagdali

texts.en: Nagdali is a very hardworking man who has for the last 15 years earned a living by raising cattle and selling milk to local dairy wholesalers. He is married and has three children, two daughters and one son. He is seeking a loan of 1,200 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva to buy more animals to raise and feed for them to eat. He believes that this will allow him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. This will be his fifth loan from our organization.

loans.use: to enlarge his herd and buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab is from Imishli. She is 38 years old and lives with her family: her husband, two daughters, and 78-year-old mother. She operates a variety store adjacent to her house. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 1000 AZN to buy additional groceries for her grocery store, such as candies, canned goods and biscuits. She has a good loan history and this is her fifth loan from AqroInvest. 

Zeynab hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her store.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Ousmane est un éleveur depuis son plus jeune âge, il habite dans une ville située à l'ouest du Sénégal. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité et pour acheter du bétail (moutons, chèvres, veaux) qu'il revend ensuite. Avec ce prêt il envisage avoir du profit qui lui permettra d'épargné et d'acheté un champ pour faire de l'agriculture.Il veut aussi être capable de répondre aux besoins de ses enfants de coté financier
texts.en:
Since his youngest age, Ousmane has been raising animals. He lives in a town in Western Senegal. He's seeking a loan to bolster her business and buy livestock (sheep, goats, calves) for resale.

With this loan, he foresees turning a profit that will enable him to put money away and buy a field for farming. He also wants to be able to provide financially for his children.

loans.use: to buy sheep, goats, and calves

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 41, is a married mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works for a local factory. 

Dung runs a small food stall and store in front of her house. Her stall and store are very convenient for many customers and she provides food for breakfast such as breads and steamed rice. She also sells a range of metal racks and appliances. She has been in this business for twenty years. 

Dung is seeking a loan to purchase foodstuffs to increase the variety of products that she sells to her customers. This will allow her to increase the turnover of her business and increase her income. She hopes that this will enabL. her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy foodstuff

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is 50 years old and married. She has three children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh city. Her husband is a worker in a local factory.

Nhung works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food stall at her house to sell many kinds of food such as beef noodles and fried savoury rice flour cake for the people in her community.

Nhung would like to take a loan to buy new furniture and repair her stall. She is hoping that through the loan she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy furniture and repair her food stall

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: Aida habite dans une localité proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Elle s'active dans le domaine de la restauration depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle veut ce prêt pour acheter des marchandises et de renforcer son stock qui est en manque permanent. Avec ce crédit elle veut avoir une activité continue et du profit qui lui garantira une autonomie financière afin d'aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en: Aida lives in a town near the capital of Senegal. She has been active in the restaurant business for over ten years. She wants this loan to buy goods and to bolster her stock, which is continuously lacking. With this loan, she wants to keep her business going and make a profit that will guarantee her some financial autonomy, so as to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mensim

texts.en:
Mensim is 30 years old. He has had a grocery store for five years. He opened his store in 2006 because the neighborhood did not have this type of business. Mensim started with a small amount of capital. He sells milk, eggs, pasta, sugar, and other products. 

Mensim is requesting his first loan from AqroInvest for 800 AZN, which he will use to buy supplies for his store. His dream is to own a store adjacent to his house and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his grocery store.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 30, is married and has two children. She lives with her children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City.   Her husband helps to support the family by operating a cell phone shop. 

Thao has been in the beauty salon business for three years. She plans to use her loan partly to buy cosmestic products to sell and partly to support her husband's business by investing in cell phone accessories to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business, repair her house and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy cosmestic products and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 39-year-old beautician. She lives in Ho Chi Minh city. Diep runs a beauty shop from her house. She began working in this profession eight years ago.

Diep is requesting a loan to buy hair dryers, steamers, stretching machines and other basic supplies for her beauty shop.  She also wants to take part in some courses related to makeup art.   She hopes that this will enabL. her to better serve her existing customers and attract new customers. 

Diep hopes that through this loan she will be abL. to generate a higher income and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: buy beauty shop equipment and take makeup classes

loans.name: Fakhar-Un-Nissa's Group

texts.en:
Fakhar-un-nissa sells clothes to financially support her family. She has good business sense. She keeps herself updated on the latest fashion and trend, which helps her understanding her clients' demand.  She purchases clothes from different cities and then sells them to her community clients on profit.
 
Fakhar-un-nissa is married and her husband has a construction supplies business. She is the mother of 8 children -- 3 of them work while the others are studying in different classes.  Fakhar-un-nissa is also a very good mother and housewife. She fulfills her household responsibilities and her family respects her very much. 

Fakhar-un-nissa has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. With this loan, she will buy clothes in bulk which will  allow her to offer more variety to her clients and increase her sales and profit.   She has been operating her business for past 10 years and is confident about her success after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Dieynaba est une commerçante depuis plus de 5 ans, elle vie dans une région limitrophe de Dakar la capitale du Sénégal. Elle demande ce crédit pour consolider son activité en renforçant son stock de marchandises (tissus, habits prêt-à-porté pour enfants). Avec ce crédit elle compte avoir du profit pour mieux rendre visible son activité en achetant une cantine au marché. Et d'aider ses frères  dans leurs activités
texts.en: Dieynaba has been a merchant for over five years. She lives in a region bordering Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She is asking for a loan to strengthen her business by bolster her stock of merchandise (fabrics, clothing, and ready-to-wear for children). With this loan, she intend to make some profit by buying a stall at the market. And to help her brothers with their businesses.

loans.use: to bolster her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong, age 45, operates an Internet shop in front of her house. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working for an electricity company. 

Luong has been engaged in her current business for three years.  She would like to request a loan to improve her business by upgrading some old computers and buying more games to attract more customers. She is confident that these additions will help her to run her business smoothly and earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: upgrade computers for her Internet shop

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 39-year-old beautician who lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in the field of construction. Thuy runs a beauty shop from her house. She began working in this profession two years ago.

Thuy is requesting a loan to repair her house and buy skin care products and other basic supplies for her beauty shop. She hopes that this will enable her to better serve her existing customers and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and set aside some savings for the future.

loans.use: to repair her house and buy skin care products and other basic supplies for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 38-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City with her children and husband. She and her husband have been running a motorcycle washing and repair business for nine years. She would like to take out a loan to expand her business by purchasing spare parts and equipment to serve a larger number of customers. 

She hopes that through the loan her business will be able to generate more income, which will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and put aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and equipment to serve a larger number of customers.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep, 49, is a married woman with a son. Her husband works in a textile factory. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

For nearly 14 years, Diep has supported her family through the income she earns from her food stall, which occupies the front of her house. She sells pork soup, fried corn, and a variety of other dishes. She intends to take a loan to buy new furniture and ingredients so that she can produce a larger quantity of food to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes her expanded business will help her improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 33 years old and married, with two sons. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in the construction field.

Thu has been making stuffed animals for 12 years. She receives the materials from toy dealers and makes the stuffed toys at her house. 

Thu would like to take out a loan to buy a new sewing machine and materials for making stuffed toys. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and materials for making stuffed toys.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s shoe-making business. He has been operating his business for the past 20 years and has a good number of business contacts. These days he has a big order to fulfill for which he wants to buy raw materials. With the loan, he will buy leather, nails, glue, and shoe polish. 

She herself is a seamstress who sews clothes for her community clients to supplement the income for her family. She is the mother of four children and all of them stay at home.
 
Sajida is very confident that after investing the loan in her husband's business, her husband will be able to finish the order on time and make great profits. 

Note: in the photo, the woman raising her hand is Sajida.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her husband's shoe-making business.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 42-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in a local hospital. For four years, she has operated a food stall to sell beef and noodles to people in her community. 

Huong would like a loan to repair her stall and buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks, and good-quality food. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract new customers. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To repair her food stall and buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks, and good-quality food to sell.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 59-year-old married woman with six sons and one daughter. She lives with her children and husband in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband have run a food stall in front of their house for the past ten years. They sells soups and noodles to people in their community. 

Hong would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more furniture, cooking appliances, and good-quality food from wholesalers. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her food business by purchasing furniture, cooking appliances, and good-quality food.

loans.name: Fareeha Naz's Group

texts.en:
Fareeha Naz is 32 years old.  She couldn’t complete her education due to financial constraints and had to leave her education after matriculation. She is married and her husband operates a grocery store in the market. He sells daily use items such as spices, sugar, cooking oil and lentils, at reasonable rates. He is very good in his customer dealings and has a good number of loyal clients who do shopping from him regularly.
 
Fareeha supports her husband financially by sewing clothes. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. She has given birth to a son and 3 daughters. All of them are studying except the youngest daughter who is only 3 years old. 

Fareeha has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk that will allow him to fulfill his client orders on time and earn extra income.  He has been operating his business for many years and Fareeha is confident that an investment will bring more profits to her family and improve its living standard. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Fareeha Naz.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is a 52-year-old married woman with a son. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Van and her husband earn an income to support their family by running a food stall in front of their house. They have been running their business for the past 15 years.

Van would like to receive a loan to purchase furniture, bowls, plates and chopsticks, as well as more food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and set aside some savings for family emergencies.

loans.use: buy furniture, bowls, plates, chopsticks, and food

loans.name: Cay

texts.en:
Cay is 51 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. 

Cay supports her family by selling noodles in crab chowder to the local people. She is asking for a loan to repair her stall and buy new furniture and appliances.   She hopes that this loan will enable her to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: repair her food stall, buy new furniture & appliances

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 36 years old, married, and has two sons. She lives with her husband and sons in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income by repairing sewing machines.

For nearly 12 years, Anh has run a general store in front of her house. She sells beverages, instant food, and household necessities to the local community.   She now intends to get a loan to buy a larger range and quantity of products in bulk for her general store. She hopes that through the loan she will be abL. to increase her income and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: buy products to sell

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 58 years old. He is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh City.   He earns money by buying and selling vehicle spare parts and accessories. He would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of spare parts and accessories to better meet his customers' needs. 

Kim hopes that through the loan his business will increase its income and ensure that his family members have better living conditions.

loans.use: buy vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is married and is the mother of a son and a daughter.  Her daughter works in a factory while her son is studying in the 9th class.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to his passengers, which also include school children in his community. 

Perveen is an embroidery expert. She prepares beautiful-looking embroidered clothes for her clients for reasonable rates. She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well. 

Perveen  has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery materials in bulk quantity to allow her to make different kinds of beautiful-looking embroidered clothes and increase her sales and profits. She is very confident that this investment will help improve her business and also the living standard of her family.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Perveen.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is a 28-year-old woman.  She is married and has a son. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her family and owns a general store to make a living. Her husband supports the family by buying and selling old motorcycles. 

Ha started her business seven years ago. She sells a range of goods from basic family necessities to instant food to people in her community. Ha uses the income she earns to feed her family and send her son to school. 

Ha is requesting a loan to stock her store with a greater range of different products such as dairy products and soft drinks. With the help of this loan she hopes to be able to offer a varied range of products to her customers and generate more income.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is a 49-year-old woman with 2 children --  1 son and 1 daughter. She is divorced and lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City.

For 10 years Ngoc has been earning income to support her family by selling soft drinks from the front of her house.  Ngoc would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of beverages and products to sell. She believes that this will help her increase the turnover of her business. 

Ngoc hopes that through this loan she will earn a higher income and be able to give her family members a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is married and is the mother of 6 children, 3 of them work to financially contribute to the family.  Her husband is a scrap dealer. He sells scraps to different factories and to other scrap dealers. Najma herself is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns a reasonable income. 

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's scrap business. With the loan, he will buy scrap materials like used paper and  plastic bottles in bulk quantities.  This will allow him to fulfill his clients' orders on time and provide them with larger quantities of scraps and increase his profits. He is very experienced in his work and has been operating his business for the past many years.  Najma is confident that an investment will help her husband increase his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Najma.

loans.use: to buy scrap materials to resell

loans.name: Bokk Diom 23 Group

texts.fr: Soda est la présidente du groupement. Ce groupement s'active dans le commerce et leur localité se situe à l'ouest du Sénégal. Soda s'active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit dans le but de renforcer son stock en marchandises en achetant des paniers de fruits (mangues, mandarines, papayes, arachides) qu'elle va revendre au marché de la ville. Elle veut avoir beaucoup de bénéfices dans son commerce et être autonomie financièrement afin de répondre aux besoins de sa familles et de payer les frais de scolarisation de sa fille
texts.en: Soda is the president of this group.  The members of this group work in commerce and they live in the west of Senegal.  Soda has been working in commerce for more than 10 years.  She is requesting this loan to strengthen her stock of merchandise.  She will buy baskets of fruit (mangos, mandarins, papayas and peanuts).  She will re-sell these products in the town market.  Soda would like to make a lot of profit in her business and be financially independent so that she can respond to her family's needs and pay her daughter's school fees.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (fruit)

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang, 49, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a labourer in a seafood factory. 

Hang supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business ten years ago. She sells sugar, soft drinks, confectionery, yoghurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy food and beverages

loans.name: Mbayang

texts.fr: Mbayang est une commerçante, elle s'active dans ce secteur depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle habite dans une ville située à l'ouest du Sénégal. Elle sollicite ce crédit dans le but de s'approvisionner en marchandises comme des fruits de mer (pagnes, crevettes, crabes) dans la petite côte qu'elle va revendre dans sa ville tout cela pour avoir une pour feuille qui lui permettra d'être autonome financièrement et de répondre aux besoins de sa familles
texts.en:
Mbayang is a retailer. She has been invovled in this line of work for more than 20 years. 

She lives in a town in the western part of Senegal. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy merchandise such as seafood (ark clams, shrimp, crab) on the coast for re-sale in her town. Her goal is to have enough money to be financially self-sufficient and to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to by merchandise.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is married and has 6 children. All of them do different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. He is a very good driver and his passengers trust his driving and like to travel on his rickshaw. Nasreen is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her household duties very efficiently. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. With the loan, he will overhaul his rickshaw and also change its body, which will allow him to provide better quality transport services to his passengers and increase his income.  Nasreen has a lot of confidence in her husband and she is very sure that after investing in his business, her husband’s income will be increased.  That will help her family to live a better financial life. 
Note: "In the photo, one of the members has an embroidery business. That's why she is holding cloth".

loans.use: To overhaul & change the body of the rickshaw

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata est une commerçante qui vie dans une localité proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis presque une dizaine d’années. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en cahiers, stylo, livre, crayons, sacs. Avec ce prêt elle compte avoir une bénéfice qui lui permettra de se lancé à la construction de sa cantine qu'elle a commencé en ville ce qui lui permettra d'être plus visible sur le marché. Elle veut au aider son mari dans les dépenses de la maisons.
texts.en: Aminata is a trader who lives in a town near the capital of Senegal.  She has been trading for almost ten years.  She is requesting this loan to strengthen her stock of merchandise (exercise books, pens, books, pencils and bags).  With this loan, she expects to make enough profits to work on building a store that she has started in town.  This will allow her to be more visible in the market.  She would also like to help her husband with their household expenses.

loans.use: to increase her stock (by purchasing merchandise)

loans.name: Djeyi

texts.fr: Djeyi est une femme commerçante, elle habite à l'ouest du Sénégal. Elle s'active dans le domaine du commerce depuis plus de 3 ans. Avec ce prêt elle veut acheté des marchandises (sacs d'arachides, du niébé) qu'elle va revendre au marché. Elle compte faire du profit pour aider ses enfants et participer sur les dépenses quotidiennes de la maison
texts.en: Djeyi is a retailer who lives in the west of Senegal.  She has been working as a retailer for more than three years.  With this loan, she would like to buy merchandise (bags of peanuts and black-eyed peas) which she will re-sell in the market.  She plans to make profits which she will use to help her children and contribute towards her daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (peanuts and black-eyed peas)

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 46 years old and is married. Her husband operates a lathe machine. He provides iron items and repair services for spare parts to his clients. He is very expert in his work and his clients are very satisfied with his work.  Razia operates a clothes business at her home.  She purchases clothes at wholesale and sells stitched and unstitched clothes to her clients, according to their demand. She makes good profits from her business every month. 
She is the mother of 3 children and all of them are getting their education by attending a nearby school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her business. With the loan, she will purchase clothes in bulk quantity. That will allow her to offer more variety of clothes to her clients and will increase her profits. 
She has recently started her business and is very hopeful that her business will improve further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Bokk Diom 15 Group

texts.fr: Rose est la présidente de ce groupement dont leur activité principale est le commerce. Elle habite dans une ville limitrophe de la capitale du Sénégal. L'activité principale de Rose est l'aviculture elle s'active dans ce domaine depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des poussins et des aliments afin d'avoir une activité à la chaîne. Elle compte avec le bénéfice qu'elle va avoir ouvrir épargné pour construire un grand poulailler dans son champ. Elle veut aussi aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne de la maison et de participé d'avantage dans la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
Rose is the president of this group whose main business activity is commerce.  She lives in a town which borders the capital of Senegal.

Rose's main business activity is agriculture and she has been in this line of work for more than ten years.  She is requesting this loan to buy some chicks and feed in order to have a production line.  She hopes to use the profits that she makes to open a savings account so that she can build a large henhouse in her field.  She would also like to help her husband with their daily household expenses and contribute more towards their children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy some chicks and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to travel abroad to buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 57 years of age and is a married woman. Her husband is a watchman by profession. His income is not enough to afford the living expenses of the whole family and so Kalsoom can't provide education to her children. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver, while the other tow work in a factory. 
Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son, who wants to buy a rickshaw.  He is currently driving a rented rickshaw.  He is not able to make good income this way. 

By purchasing a rickshaw, he will be able to work for longer hours without any time limitations and he can increase his profits. 
He has 3 years of experience in his work, and Kalsoom is confident about the improvement of her son’s business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Ousmane habite dans une région de l'ouest du Sénégal. Il est commerçant et s'active dans ce domaine depuis 1997. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des marchandises au Sud du Sénégal comme (miel, niébé, huile de palme,). Avec ce prêt il envisage renforcé son activité  en augmentant ses achats de marchandises afin d'avoir beaucoup plus de bénéfices. Ce qui lui permettra d'avoir une autonomie financière et d'aider sa famille dans les  dépenses quotidiens
texts.en:
Ousmane lives in a region in western Senegal. He is a merchant and has been active in this domain since 1997. He is requesting this loan to buy some goods (like honey, black-eyed peas, palm oil) in South Senegal.  

With this loan, Ousmane envisions bolstering his business by increasing his purchasing in order to earn much more profit. This will enable him to have some financial autonomy and to assist his family with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ameer's Group

texts.en:
Ameer sells clothes in order to financially support her family. She purchases clothes at wholesale and sells at a profit to her community clients. She keeps herself updated about latest trends in fashion and makes reasonably good profits from her business.  Her husband has a motorbike rental business. He gives bikes to his clients on a rental basis and charges by the hour.  Ameer is the mother of 3 sons. One of them also sells clothes, while the other two are studying.  Besides her business, she also performs her household duties very well. Her family is very happy with her for her good management qualities. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her clothes business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk and of better quality.  That will allow her to offer more variety to her clients and to increase her profits.  She has been doing her business for the past 5 years and she is very confident about the success of her business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata habite dans une localité près de la capitale du Sénégal. Elle fait du commerce depuis 2 ans. Elle veut ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités en achetant des fruits ( mangues, oranges et d'autres produits). Elle veut avec ce prêt avoir du bénéfice pour palier à ses besoins et d'augmenter son pouvoir d'achat afin d'avoir une activité beaucoup plus rentable
texts.en:
Aminata lives in a town near the capital of Senegal. She's been a merchant for two years. She would like a loan to bolster her business by buying fruits (mangoes, oranges, and other products).

She would like this loan to increase the profitability of her business, and use her profits to provide for herself and increase her buying power.

loans.use: to buy fruits (mangoes, oranges)

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is very supportive and sells clothes to financially support her husband. She started her business many years ago. She makes good profits from her business which allows her to pay off the utilities and  better manage her household expenses. Her husband is a daily wage laborer. She is the mother of 8 children: 7 of them are studying, while the remaining one is working. 

Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her clothes business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different variety that will allow her to make more profits for her family.  She is very confident about the success of her business after the loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy melons

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan trabaja realizando cortes y bañando a perros a domicilio. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar herramientas de trabajo como ser: cepillos, shampoo, tijeras y demás insumos; así podrá a futuro abrir un salón de belleza canina. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y  no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan provides dog grooming services from his home. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies for his work such as brushes, shampoo, scissors, and other items. In the future, he would like to open a dog grooming salon. This job is how he earns income to cover his expenses. Juan lives at home with his parents in the District of San Antonio of the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy brushes, shampoo, scissors, and other items for his dog grooming business.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La señora Miriam trabaja como secretaria  y también percibe una renta de jubilación. El crédito lo requiere para iniciar el negocio de venta de cosmeticos.  Miriam  va a comprar cosméticos para su venta a clientes que ya han comprometido la primera compra. Vive en casa en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona  San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz; es divorciada, tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que Miriam obtiene un crédito esperando mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Miriam works as a secretary, but she also receives income from a retirement pension. The loan she is requesting will be used to start a business of selling cosmetics. Miriam will buy cosmetics to sell to customers who have already promised to make their first purchase with her. She lives in her own home in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz. Miriam is divorced and has two children.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan and she hopes to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa americana de primera calidad, tanto para varones como para mujeres. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital y así adquirir dos fardos (son costales llenos de ropa) que contienen buena cantidad y variedad de ropa. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Villa Copacabana de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta será la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo de Impro y la primera a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria sells American clothes that are of first-rate quality for men and women. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital so that she acquire two bundles (sacks full of clothing) that are of good quality and contain a variety of items. Maria lives in a rented house in the District of Villa Copacabana in the city of La Paz.

This will be the second time she has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the first time through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of American clothes.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y su esposo es chofer y también trabaja como mecánico. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como ser: refrescos, dulces y conservas para surtir su tienda de abarrotes. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Cotahuma de la Ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha sells groceries. Her husband is a chauffeur and also works as a mechanic. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as soft drinks, candy, and preserves so that she can restock her store. Martha lives at the home of her parents in the District of Cotahuma in the city of La Paz. She is married and has two children.

This is the first time she has requested a loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candy, and preserves.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es empleado; trabaja en un taller de costura y su esposa trabaja con ayudante de cocina. El crédito lo requiere para cubrir un tratamiento medico para su cuñado quien sufrió un accidente automovilístico y no tiene ninguna clase de seguro laboral. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de  Pasankeri en la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solícita un crédito en IMPRO, y por el carácter social se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is employed. He works at a sewing workshop while his wife works as a kitchen assistant. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for the medical treatment for his brother-in-law, who suffered an automobile accident and does not have any type of work insurance. Juan lives at home with his parents in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO. Because of his social character, his loan is being referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to pay for his brother-in-law's medical treatment.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Rubén es agricultor y maestro albañil; también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y su esposa lo ayuda con las actividades agrícolas. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de una motobomba de agua que mejorará el cultivo en sus tierras. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vicarani en la provincia Aroma; es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito tanto de Impro como de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Rubén is a farmer and master bricklayer. He also buys and sells cattle. His wife helps with the farming activities. With the money from this loan, he will be able to pay the cost of a water pump so that he can improve the crops on his land. Rubén lives in his own home in the town of Vicarani in Aroma Province. He is married and has five children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a water pump so that he can improve his crops.

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es: La señora Gladiz es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de edredones a profesoras; además es jubilada. Con esta actividad de venta de edredones cubre sus gastos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de edredones para variar y satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona Norte en la Ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos. Esta será la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva y la quinta vez que solicita un crédito de Impro.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladiz is a merchant who sells quilts to teachers. She is also retired. Through her business of selling quilts, Gladiz is able to cover her expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy various quilts so that she can cater to the preferences of her customers. Gladiz lives in her own home in the northern part of the city of La Paz. She is married and has two children.

This is the second time she has requested a loan through Kiva, but this is her fifth loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy quilts of various colors and sizes.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: La señora Catalina es comerciante de carne en uno de los  mercados  de la ciudad de La Paz y con esta actividad cubre sus gastos. El crédito lo requiere el aumento de capital y comprar 150 kilos de carne de res y de cerdo. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Obispo en la Ciudad de La Paz; es viuda y tiene cinco hijos pero ya están casados. Catalina es cliente desde el año 2007 y esta será la tercera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina is a meat merchant at one of the markets in the city of La Paz. This business helps to cover her expenses. The loan she is requesting will increase her capital so that she can buy 150 kilos of beef and pork. She lives in a rented house located in the District of Obispo in the city of La Paz. Catalina is a widow and has five children who are already married.

She has been a client since 2007 and this is the third time her loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy 150 kilos of beef and pork.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: El señor Fidel es sastre y confecciona trajes para varón. El crédito lo requiere para el comprar materia prima como ser: telas, hilos, forros, botones y demás insumos requeridos para su especialidad. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani en la Ciudad de La Paz; Fidel es casado y tiene dos hijos. Fidel se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que obtuvo anteriormente pues le ayudaron a mejorar la situación económica de su familia. También es cliente antiguo de Kiva, pues esta es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva, y la sexta a través de Impro.
texts.en:
Sr. Fidel is a tailor who makes men’s suits. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials such as thread, fabric, lining, buttons, and other supplies that are required for his specialty. He lives in his own home in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. Fidel is married and has two children.

He is very pleased with the loans he received previously because they have helped to improve his family’s financial situation. Fidel is also a long-time client who has appeared on Kiva. This is the third time he has a requested a loan through Kiva, but it is his sixth loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, lining, buttons, and other supplies for making men's suits.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: El señor Felipe es empleado; trabaja como mesero para eventos sociales todos los fines de semana y algunos días durante la semana cuando lo contratan. Felipe también da clases de música. Con estas actividades cubre sus gastos. El crédito lo requiere para el pago  de estudios universitarios, Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro en la Ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en Impro y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Felipe is employed. He works as a waiter at social events every weekend and on some days during the week when he is hired. Felipe also teaches music classes. With these jobs, he is able to cover his expenses.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for his university studies. He lives at home with his parents in the District of Alta San Pedro in the city of La Paz. Felipe is single and has no children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the registration fees and tuition for his university studies.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es: La señora Marcia es empleada, trabaja  en una empresa de telecomunicaciones como mensajera y como portera; con esta actividad cubre sus gastos. El crédito lo requiere para el pago  de estudios universitarios, pues necesita pagar la matricula y las mensualidades. Vive en las mismas instalaciones de su trabajo, donde existe un pequeño departamento, que queda ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro en la Ciudad de La Paz; es casada y  tiene dos hijos. Marcia es cliente de Impro desde el año 2010 y esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcia is employed at a telecommunications company where she works as a messenger and as the building superintendent. This job helps to cover her expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for her university studies. Her tuition and monthly fees are due. Marcia lives on the company property where she has a small apartment. She resides in the District of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. Marcia is married and has two children.

She has been a client of IMPRO since 2010 and this is the second time that her loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: El señor Genaro  es chofer y también trabaja en una estación radial en un programa relacionado con deportes y con estas actividades cubre sus gastos. El crédito lo requiere para el pago  de estudios universitarios en la carrera de comunicación social. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro en la Ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Genaro ya obtuvo un préstamo anterior a través de Kiva y esta será la segunda vez que solicita otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Genaro is a chauffeur, but he also works on a sports program at a radio station. These activities help him to cover his expenses. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for his university studies. He is working on a degree in Social Communications. Genaro lives at home with his parents in the District of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

Genaro obtained his previous loan through Kiva and this will be his second loan request.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La señora Blanca es comerciante de productos de belleza y también trabaja como profesora, de tal manera que con estas dos  actividades cubre sus gastos. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital y comprar cremas para las manos, para la piel, hidratantes, etc. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Vino Tinto en la Ciudad de La Paz; Blanca está separada y tiene un hijo.  Esta es la segunda vez que Blanca desea que su crédito sea canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca is a merchant who sells beauty products. She also works as a teacher. Both of these activities enable her to cover her expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy hand creams, skin creams, moisturizers, and other products. Blanca lives in her own home in the District of Vino Tinto in the city of La Paz. She is separated from her spouse and has one child.

This is the second time her loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy hand creams, skin creams, moisturizers, and other products.

loans.name: Paraiso Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité “PARAISO POTY” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Actualmente esta integrado por 14 mujeres, las cuales trabajan dentro de un ambiente de respeto y ayuda mutua.
Una de las miembros es la señora Hipolita, la cual es una señora trabajadora, luchadora, sacrificada y muy emprendedora. Comenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, lo cual le genera los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Le gustaría poder seguir con su trabajo, por lo que ella junto al comité acuden a la fundación.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de animales y alimentos para los mismos.
texts.en:
The “Paraíso Poty" committee was created through the union of several neighbors from the city of Santaní.  All the members of the committee carry out their own independent business activities such as selling products.  The members created a very united group.  They are capable of carrying out activities together to strengthen their camaraderie.  The group currently has 14 female members who work in an atmosphere of respect and mutual help.

One of the members of this group is Hipolita, who is a hard-working, tenacious, self-sacrificing and very entrepreneurial lady.  She says that she raises and sells animals which makes her the income she needs to support her family.  She would like to be able to continue in her work and so she and her committee are approaching Fundación Paraguaya.  She is requesting her loan to buy animals and feed for the animals.

loans.use: to buy animals and nutritionally-balanced feed

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos es sastre. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de telas, hilos, broches, botones, etc.; con esta actividad cubre los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa en alquiler misma queda ubicada en la zona de 14 de septiembre en la Ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene tres hijos pero ya están casados. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que obtuvo anteriormente pues hizo crecer su negocio y ahora tiene más trabajo, por lo cual necesita el préstamo. Esta será la cuarta vez que toma la decisión de su crédito sea enviado a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos is a tailor. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fabrics, thread, clasps, buttons, and other items. This business helps to cover his family’s expenses. Carlos lives in a rented house in the September 14th District of the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children who are also married.

Carlos is very satisfied with the loans he obtained previously because they have helped him to grow his business. Now that he has more work, he needs another loan. This is the fourth time his loan will be referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, clasps, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Ana Delmi

texts.es:
Ana, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo debido a la necesidad de comprar papelería para el negocio, específicamente libros, obras, novelas, tintas de impresoras.
Los préstamos han sido un gran apoyo para el negocio de Ana, su puntualidad en los pagos le ha permitido mantener a los clientes satisfechos, y mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Ana decided to take out a new loan because she needs to buy products for her business, specifically books, plays, novels and ink cartridges. 

Loans have been a great support for Ana's business.  Her punctuality in making her repayments has allowed her to keep her customers happy and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy books and ink cartridges

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires and a gas tank for his vehicle.

loans.name: Elvia Noemi

texts.es: Elvia, necesita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de hilo de seda y comprara maíz, estos materiales le ayudaran para continuar produciendo tanto tortillas como hamacas, esta será un nuevo apoyo para mejorar el negocio. Ella ha contado con este apoyo que le ha ayudado para mantener a su familia, pues con los elementos que compra fabrica las hamacas y tambien compra maiz para hacer la venta de tortillas.
texts.en: Elvia needs a new loan to buy silk thread and corn.  These materials will help her to continue producing both tortillas and hammocks.  This will be a new support to her in improving her business.  This support has helped Elvia to provide for her family.  She uses the items that she buys to make her hammocks and also buys corn to make tortillas to sell.

loans.use: to buy silk thread and corn

loans.name: Valdivia

texts.es: La señora Valdivia es comerciante de ropa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción ya que realizara la obra fina del piso superior de su casa  y colocado de cerámica. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Llojeta en la Ciudad de La Paz; Valdivia es casada y tiene tres hijos. Valdivia es cliente de Impro desde al año 2005, sus pagos siempre han sido puntuales y esta será la segunda vez que desea que su crédito pase a través de Kiva y sus financiadores.
texts.en:
Sra. Valdivia is a clothing merchant. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials so that she can finish the upper floor of her house and install ceramic tiling. Her home is located in the District of Llojeta in the city of La Paz. Valdivia is married and has three children.

She has been a client of IMPRO since 2005. Her payments have always been on time and this will be the second time that her loan will be referred to the Kiva lenders for funding.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for finishing the upper floor of her house and installing ceramic tiles.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es: El señor Valentín desempeña el trabajo de albañil y también es ayudante de costura. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción, piedra, cemento, arena, ya que realizara la  construcción de una habitación. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Munaypata en la Ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene dos hijos. Su historial de créditos data del año  2007, con tres créditos anteriores completamente pagados. Esta es la segunda vez que Valentín ha pedido que su crédito sea financiado a  través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Valentín has a job as a bricklayer, but he is also an assistant tailor. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as stone, cement, and sand in order to finish the construction of a room. Valentín lives in his own home in the District of Munaypata in the city of La Paz. He is married and has two children.

His credit history dates back to 2007. Valentín has had three previous loans that were completely repaid. This is the second time he has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to finish building a room in his house.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
la señora Maria, ya es un cliente D. la Fundación Campo, ella tiene un préstamo actualmente y es un miembro Kiva. ese préstamo lo utilizo para comprar productos para surtir su tienda como perfumenes, ropa, utiles escolares, etc. y ella esta muy contenta con los resultados obtenidos y agracese a la ayuda resivida por medio D. KIVA. actualmente ella solicita un nuevo préstamo, debido a que se avecina una temporada muy buena para la venta D. coronas y ramos, para el dia D. difuntos. El dia D. difuntos es una tradición en El Salvador y se realizan los dias 1 y 2 D. noviembre, dias en los cuales las personas asisten a los cementerios donD. tienen enterrados a sus seres queridos: mamá, papá, hermanos, tios, amigos, etc. y le llevan flores D. papel o naturales. Hay personas como Maria que se encargan D. elaborar lindas coronas con flores D. diferentes colores, tamaños y figuras, para venderlas a las personas para que se las lleven a las tumbas D. sus  seres queridos.

Maria espera trabajar bien como lo hizo con el primer credito, para obtener ingresos que le ayuden a dar a sus hijos lo necesario y para que su negocio siga fuerte y prosperando
texts.en:
Maria is already a client of Fundación Campo.  She currently has a loan and is a Kiva member.  She used her existing loan to buy products with which to stock her store such as perfumes, clothes, school supplies etc.  She is very happy with the results she is obtaining and is grateful for this repeat help through Kiva.

Maria is currently requesting a new loan because a very good season is approaching for selling wreaths and bouquets.  The Day of the Dead is a tradition in El Salvador which takes place on November 1st and 2nd.  On these days, people go to cemeteries where their loved ones are buried (mom, dad, brothers, aunts, uncles, friends, etc.) and they take with them either paper flowers or fresh flowers.  There are people such as Maria who make beautiful wreaths from flowers of different sizes, colors and shapes in order to sell them to people so that they can take them to the graves of their loved ones.

Maria hopes to work well as she did with her first loan, in order to make income which will help her to proviD. her children with what they need and help strengthen her business and enable it to do well.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making wreaths and bouquets for Day of the Dead

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa es agricultora y realiza la actividad de compra y venta de tubérculos (papa, chuño). Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de una motobomba así mejorar el riego y la producción de tubérculos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vicarani en la provincia 	Aroma; es casada  y tiene  un  hijo. Es la primera vez que Josefa obtiene un crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefa is a farmer who buys and sells tubers, such as potatoes and “chuños” (freeze dried potatoes). The money from this loan will cover the cost of a water pump so that she can improve the irrigation and production of her tuber crops. Josefa lives in her own home in the town of Vicarani in Aroma Province. She is married and has one child.

This is the first time Josefa has obtained a loan.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for improving the irrigation of her tuber crops.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El señor Leonardo es agricultor y maestro albañil que realiza trabajos dos veces al mes  y su esposa lo ayuda con las actividades agrícolas, produciendo papa. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de una motobomba así mejorar el riego para su  producción. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vicarani en la provincia Aroma; es casado y  tiene cinco  hijos. Es la primera vez que Leonardo obtiene un crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Leonardo is a farmer and master bricklayer who works on masonry jobs twice a month. His wife helps with the farming activities and growing potatoes. The money from this loan will cover the cost of a water pump so that he can improve the irrigation of his crops. Leonardo lives in his own home in the town of Vicarani in Aroma Province. He is married and has five children.

This is the first time Leonardo has obtained a loan.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to improve the irrigation of his crops.

loans.name: Nicacio

texts.es: El señor Nicacio es agricultor y maestro albañil y también su esposa lo ayuda con las actividades agrícolas. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de una motobomba para facilitar las condiciones de trabajo en el riego para la producción de tubérculos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vicarani en la provincia 	Aroma; es casado y tiene  tres hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Nicacio is a farmer and master bricklayer. His wife helps with the farming activities. With the money from this loan, he will pay for the cost of a water pump that will facilitate irrigation for growing tubers. Nicacio lives in his own home in the town of Vicarani in Aroma Province. He is married and has three children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan.

loans.use: to buy a water pump in order to facilitate irrigation.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Estaban es chofer y trabaja en el sindicato en uno de los sindicatos de transportistas de la ciudad de La Paz como socio asalariado. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá los gastos de una intervención quirúrgica de la vesícula, pues los médicos le han dicho que debe operarse. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Villa Yunguyo  en al ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y  no tiene hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Esteban is a chauffeur and works for one of the transportation unions in the city of La Paz as a salaried member. The money from this loan will be used to cover the cost of a gallbladder operation because his doctors have said that he needs this surgery. Esteban lives in his own home in the District of Villa Yunguo in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

This is the second time that his loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for an operation.

loans.name: Nilda Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra Nilda, está casada hace 50 años con el señor Francisco, quien es  D.  profesión comerciante, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores, 2 mujeres y un varón quienes ya están casados y viven en forma independiente, una D. las hijas vive y trabaja en los Estados Unidos.
Nilda es D. profesión modista, vive en su casa propia, junto con su marido y una D. sus nietas, en la casa cuenta con un taller D. costura, y además su esposo cuenta con una pequeña despensa y venta D. artículos D. ferretería. Según comentó su esposo había trabajado en una gran Ferretería y tiempo después se jubiló, y por esa razón se dedica también a la venta D. los artículos D. ferretería.
La sra Nilda cuenta con una amplia clientela formada y realiza trabajos D. alta costura en especial para acontecimientos especiales.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, hilos, agujas, cierres, botones y otros con los cuales podrá surtir su taller.
texts.en:
Nilda has been married to Francisco for fifty years.  He is a salesman by profession.  The couple have three grown-up children (two daughters and one son) who are married and live independently.  One of their daughters lives and works in the United States.

Nilda is a dressmaker by profession.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and one of her granddaughters.  She has a sewing workshop at home and her husband has a small general store / hardware store.  She says that her husband used to work in a large hardware store.  He retired and then decided to start selling hardware.

Nilda has a large, established customer base and she makes haute couture garments for special occasions.

Nilda is requesting this loan to buy fabric, threads, needles, fasteners, buttons and other supplies with which she will stock her workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, needles, fasteners and buttons

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: El señor Zenón es agricultor y trabaja como mecánico en la ciudad de El Alto y su esposa e hijos lo ayudan con los trabajos de agricultura y producción de tubérculos.
